translation.en: [woman] There's absolutely nothing to do around here.
So, instead of doing drugs, I go out in the woods.
translation.ko: 그래서 마약을 하는 대신 숲을 거닐곤 하죠

translation.en: Even though people think that I'm cra… [laughs]
I probably do look crazy out there digging for rocks.
translation.ko: 돌 캐고 있는 모습을 보면 미친 것처럼 보이긴 하겠네요

translation.en: But I… I really like looking for rocks and fossils.
I think it's cool, so whatever.
I have some cool fossils except for the one that turned out to be dog poo.
translation.ko: 멋진 화석도 몇 개 발견했어요 하나는 알고 보니 개똥이었지만요

translation.en: I look for just a few different types of crystals.
Healing powers, your chakra.
It helps me clear my mind.
[Brittany] I was arrested for murder.
The man was in my home.
translation.ko: 우리 집에 있던 어떤 남자 때문에

translation.en: I did what I thought I had to do,
what I did have to do, no doubt in my mind.
translation.ko: 그 방법밖에 없었다고 저는 굳게 믿어요

translation.en: 'Cause If I wouldn't have, my brother and I would both be dead right now.
translation.ko: 안 그랬더라면 남동생이랑 전 죽었을 거예요

translation.en: I'm ready for my Stand Your Ground hearing.
translation.ko: 스탠드 유어 그라운드 심리 준비를 마쳤어요

translation.en: If they let me tell my story, I believe that I'll win.
translation.ko: 제 이야기를 들어 준다면 분명 이길 거라고 생각해요

translation.en: [woman] I've covered Stand Your Ground cases before,
translation.ko: 스탠드 유어 그라운드법 관련 사건을 여럿 다뤄봤는데

translation.en: and almost all of them, they were men.
Stand Your Ground is a self-defense law in Alabama.
And so, the police may go to a scene, you know, find that someone's been killed,
translation.ko: 누군가가 살해당한 현장에 경찰이 출동했다고 칩시다

translation.en: and then they'll just say it was justified.
translation.ko: 살인을 저지른 사람이 정당방위라 주장하는 거예요

translation.en: And they often dismiss cases.
In Brittany's case, she was charged with killing a man
who she accused of raping her.
translation.ko: 살해했다는 혐의를 받았죠 "살인 용의자, 대배심에 기소"

translation.en: And, if she is convicted, she could face up to life in prison.
translation.ko: 유죄로 판결 나면 무기징역을 받을 판이었어요 "강간 피해 주장 앨라배마주 여성 살해 혐의로 무기징역 가능성"

translation.en: And so the most compelling thing to me was,
translation.ko: 제가 가장 주목한 부분은 다음과 같았습니다

translation.en: "Are women able to use the system to defend themselves
in the way that men are?"
[woman] I have two kids.
-There's my lovely brother. -[woman] Brittany and Chris.
Say hi, Chris!
Their father and I divorced when they were four and eight.
translation.ko: 애들이 각각 4살, 8살일 때 애 아빠와 이혼했어요 "러모나 매캘리 브리트니의 어머니"

translation.en: I was a single mom.
In Jackson County, it's hard to be a single mom
translation.ko: 잭슨 카운티에서는 싱글 맘으로 살기 어려워요

translation.en: because there's not much financial assistance whatsoever
for a single mom.
I worked anywhere from 12 to 16 hours a day,
sometimes more if I could get more in, you know.
But we ended up living in the projects.
translation.ko: 그런데도 결국 정부 지원 주택에 살았어요

translation.en: Brittany, she was smart as a whip.
I mean, that child could pass a test, any test,
without ever even crackin' a book.
She was just really a honor roll student.
Brittany got married. I guess she was 19.
And then her husband left and went back to his mom's.
translation.ko: 그런데 남편이 브리트니를 떠나 자기 엄마 집으로 갔죠

translation.en: They got back together, they separated, they got back together.
translation.ko: 그다음 다시 만났다가 따로 살았다가 다시 만났어요

translation.en: I quit keeping up because it was just like,
translation.ko: 매번 그런 식이라 일일이 세는 것도 그만뒀죠

translation.en: "Just let me know how many plates to set," you know, or… [laughs]
translation.ko: '이번엔 몇 인분 차릴지나 말해' 그런 식이었어요

translation.en: She has four kids,
and she's had some hardships being a single mom.
translation.ko: 브리트니도 싱글 맘으로 살면서 힘든 일이 많았죠

translation.en: Trying to work, trying to take care of the kids,
and then depression, it really hit her hard.
When Brittany had Baby Will,
Baby Will had, uh, Potter's syndrome.
It… it's a genetic disorder.
He just lived 45 minutes.
When she lost a full-born child, Brittany went out in left field
translation.ko: 열 달 품었던 아이를 잃고 너무 고통스러운 나머지

translation.en: and found peace somewhere else with addiction.
Oh, it's raining.
It's gotten really bad in Jackson County, as a whole, with the drugs.
And it wasn't that way when I was a kid, you know, growin' up.
When I noticed my daughter started lookin' like a toothpick…
She started hanging out with different people--
[woman on intercom] Can I take your order? Do y'all want anything?
You good? Um…
I need two sausage, egg, and cheese McGriddles.
translation.ko: 소시지, 계란이랑 치즈 맥그리들 두 개요

translation.en: -Thanks. -[woman] Have a good day.
You too.
But, um, anyway, um, it was just one hell of a ride.
I'm just gonna tell you.
[Brittany] I started using methamphetamine.
And then, just a few months in, I lost my kids.
translation.ko: 몇 개월 지나지 않아 애들 양육권을 뺏겼죠

translation.en: My world was gone.
[Ramona] When she lost child custody, she hit rock bottom.
translation.ko: 아이들 양육권을 잃었던 때가 인생 최악의 시기였을 거예요

translation.en: We did support and help her as… as much as we could.
And she struggled. She relapsed a couple of times.
translation.ko: 브리트니도 힘들어했죠 몇 차례 재활에 실패했어요

translation.en: But she pulled herself back up.
She did get clean, and she stayed clean.
And, I mean, she was workin' at a home, doin' good.
And on January the 10th of 2018,
Brittany had a home evaluation done on her home.
Made sure everything was safe for the kids, and, um, she passed it.
translation.ko: 아이들이 와서 지낼 수 있게요 그리고 평가에 통과했어요

translation.en: The lady told her she was proud of her.
-Wow! -[Ramona] Brittany was super excited.
We had waited so long to get these kids back.
translation.ko: 아이들을 다시 보기 위해 얼마나 오래 기다렸는데요

translation.en: So you had a good time, huh? Which one was your favorite animal to see?
translation.ko: 재밌게 놀았구나? 어떤 동물이 제일 좋았어?

translation.en: [girl over phone] The llama!
The llama? Did it try to spit on you?
[Ashley] Brittany was looking to buy a puppy.
She wanted that puppy for the kids.
Todd Smith, he was a pit bull breeder.
She had met Todd back in, like, high school days.
translation.ko: 고등학교 시절 브리트니와 알게 된 사이였죠

translation.en: Brittany arranged with him to purchase a pit bull puppy, which she did.
translation.ko: 브리트니는 토드를 만나 실제로 핏불 새끼를 샀습니다

translation.en: It was only just a couple of days later that the shooting happened.
translation.ko: 그 후 며칠 지나지 않아 총격 사건이 발생했죠

translation.en: [Brittany] I get a call from Todd asking if I would come and get him from the park
translation.ko: 토드에게서 연락이 왔어요 공원에 있는데 데리러 와 달라고요

translation.en: because his ride had dropped him off, and they wouldn't come back and get him.
translation.ko: 차에 태워 주기로 한 사람이 그냥 내려주고 다시 안 온다면서요

translation.en: So I told him, you know, "All right, we'll come and get you."
"You can stay on my couch for one night, but tomorrow you have got to leave."
"You can't just hole up at my house. It's not a crash house."
translation.ko: '우리 집에서 살게는 못 해 그런 곳 아니야'

translation.en: "I'm about to get my kids home."
And we talked for a little while.
And I wasn't trying to brag, but I was like,
translation.ko: 자랑하려는 건 아니었지만 이런 말을 했어요

translation.en: "You know, I'm working. I'm about to get my children back."
"Things are looking forward for me."
And then…
…I don't know what happened. Something snapped inside of this man.
And he jumped up and started screaming at me.
translation.ko: 갑자기 제게 달려들더니 소리를 마구 질러댔어요

translation.en: And he headbutts me.
So I take off runnin' through the hallway to my bedroom, and I slam the door.
translation.ko: "현장 사진" 그래서 복도를 지나 침실로 달아나 문을 쾅 닫았어요

translation.en: And, um, he busted through the door and tackled me on the bed
translation.ko: "현장 사진" 그런데 문을 열고 들어오더니 침대에 저를 눕히고

translation.en: and started choking me.
And then I saw black, and I thought,
translation.ko: 눈앞이 새까맣게 변하며 이런 생각이 들었죠

translation.en: "This is what it's like to die. God, please don't let me die."
translation.ko: '죽음이란 이런 것이구나 신이시여, 절 죽이지 마세요'

translation.en: And, uh, I woke up, and I peed on myself. And my pants are off,
translation.ko: 정신을 차려 보니 오줌을 쌌고 바지가 벗겨져 있었어요

translation.en: and he's raping me.
And he's still choking me.
And he says, "If you say one F-ing word, I will kill you." [sniffs]
He said, "If you even breathe wrong, I will kill you."
Brittany called, I guess, about 12:40.
And she said, um,
"Mama, will you bring me a pack of cigarettes?"
And I said, um,
"Baby, I don't have any money till Wednesday or Thursday," you know?
translation.ko: '얘, 나 수요일이나 목요일까진 돈 없는 거 알잖니'

translation.en: And, uh, she said, "Mama, I've got money."
translation.ko: '얘, 나 수요일이나 목요일까진 돈 없는 거 알잖니' 그러니까 '돈은 나한테 있어'

translation.en: She said, "Just… just get over here and take me to the store."
'Cause we were down to the one car, you know.
I was so tired.
I had worked that day.
It was freezing cold and snowin'.
My hair was wet, and I was like,
"Chris, can you just go take your sister to the store to get some cigarettes?"
translation.ko: 그래서 크리스에게 누나 데리고 담배 사러 갔다 오라고 부탁했죠

translation.en: [Chris] I'm a little bit irritated because I'm tired.
translation.ko: "크리스 매캘리 브리트니의 남동생" 피곤해서 짜증 난 상태였지만

translation.en: But I… I get up, and I head to Brittany's house.
I thought it was just gonna be me and her going to the store.
translation.ko: 그냥 둘이서만 가게에 갈 줄 알았거든요

translation.en: But then Todd comes out behind Brittany, and Brittany gets in the front seat.
translation.ko: 근데 누나 뒤로 토드가 나왔고 누나는 조수석에 앉았어요

translation.en: Brittany was not talking as much, but I didn't pay much attention.
translation.ko: 평소보다 말이 없었지만 그다지 신경 쓰지 않았죠

translation.en: I drive over into MAPCO.
While she's in the store, me and Todd are talkin' in the car.
translation.ko: 누나가 가게에 있는 동안 저랑 토드는 대화를 했어요

translation.en: [woman] I was taking care of a customer, and Brittany comes in.
She is, like, all out of sorts.
You could tell she looked like she'd been in a fight.
translation.ko: "페이지 페인터 가게 직원" 막 싸운 사람 같았죠

translation.en: And then I'm like, "What happened to you?"
And then, as soon as I said that, she was like, "Shh."
You know, "Don't draw any attention."
And that's when she started telling me what happened to her.
That she was being held hostage,
that she had been raped, beaten by Todd Smith.
And I was like, "Just stay here. Like, get in this room."
translation.ko: 저는 여기 있으라고 안쪽 방으로 들어가라고 했는데

translation.en: And she said, "I can't. My brother's in the car."
translation.ko: 남동생이 차에 있어서 안 된다고 하더군요

translation.en: "If I don't go back out there, he's gonna hurt my brother."
translation.ko: 자기가 안 돌아가면 남동생을 해칠 거라면서요

translation.en: [Chris] After a minute, she comes out,
and I go to pull off to take them back home.
translation.ko: 저는 차를 빼서 두 사람을 집으로 데려갔죠

translation.en: Todd gets out of the car first and starts to walk upstairs to go in the house,
translation.ko: 토드가 차에서 나와 먼저 집으로 들어갔어요

translation.en: and Brittany, before she gets out,
she tells me that I need to go back to the MAPCO to talk to one of the clerks.
translation.ko: 저더러 맵코로 돌아가서 직원 하나와 얘기하라고 말했어요

translation.en: [Paige] He was clueless. Like, he had no idea.
And I started tellin' him, and he was like, "What?"
[Chris] So, I'm driving back over to the house.
I always had my pistol right here on my side.
I… I went in the back door,
and… and Todd's in the kitchen, gettin' something to drink.
translation.ko: 토드가 마실 걸 찾아서 주방에 있더군요

translation.en: I told him that he needed to get his stuff and leave.
translation.ko: 제가 짐 챙겨서 그만 나가라고 했어요

translation.en: He's just standing there, not movin'.
I just wanted Todd gone.
I put my gun on the counter
and try to physically remove him from the house,
translation.ko: 조리대에 총을 올려놓고 집에서 끌어내려고 하자

translation.en: and then… then that's when the fight started.
[Brittany] I run into the kitchen, and they're fighting.
translation.ko: 주방으로 달려가 보니 둘이 싸우고 있더라고요

translation.en: And Todd has my brother, choking him out.
translation.ko: 토드가 제 남동생 목을 조르고 있었죠

translation.en: I picked up the gun, and I said, "Todd, stop."
translation.ko: 저는 총을 주워 들어 토드에게 그만하라고 했죠

translation.en: "I don't want to have to shoot anybody. Please let my brother go."
translation.ko: "크리스, 토드, 브리트니" '총 쏘고 싶지 않아 내 동생 그만 놔줘'

translation.en: And he wouldn't, so I fired the gun.
And nothing happened.
And so I shot again.
With the third time, my brother and him fell down.
translation.ko: 세 번째 쐈을 때 동생과 토드가 쓰러졌죠

translation.en: [operator] Jackson County 911.
[Brittany] Hi. I need an ambulance. Someone just, um, got shot.
translation.ko: 여기 구급차 보내주세요 누가 총을 맞았어요

translation.en: [operator] Where's the person that shot him?
[Brittany] He's right here with me. He's my brother. He's not going to jail.
translation.ko: 여기 저랑 있어요 제 남동생인데 감옥엔 안 가요

translation.en: He's like… he was trying to protect me.
What the fuck do I do? Please help me.
[operator] Okay, you're gonna pump his chest hard and fast 30 times.
[Brittany cries] One, two, three, four…
Please send an ambulance. Please.
[operator] They're on the way and comin' as fast as they can, okay?
-[siren wailing] -[Brittany] Okay. I'm going to the road.
-[Brittany] In here! -[officer 1] Where… Who's the shooter?
-Who's the shooter? -[Brittany] It's my brother.
[officer 1] Where's he at? Come out of the house!
-[Brittany] Don't shoot. -[officer 1] Come on!
translation.ko: - 경찰 수색 잘 받아 - 이리 와요

translation.en: [Brittany] He shot him 'cause he choked me.
translation.ko: - 저놈이 제 목을 졸라서 쐈어요 - 이리요

translation.en: -[officer 1] Come on out! -[Brittany] He raped me.
[officer 2] Hold a minute. Is there anybody in the house?
translation.ko: 잠시만요 집에 다른 사람이 또 있나요?

translation.en: -[Brittany] No. -[officer 2] Stay here.
Found him downstairs.
-[officer 1] No pulse. -[officer 2] No pulse. No pulse. Okay.
translation.ko: - 맥박 안 잡힙니다 - 맥박 없음, 네

translation.en: [Chris] You know, I was raised to do the right thing,
even though the rest of the world may not see it like that.
translation.ko: 세상 사람들 눈에 그렇게 보이지 않더라도요

translation.en: In Jackson County, women don't get treated fairly in general.
translation.ko: 잭슨 카운티에서 여성은 정당한 대우를 못 받아요

translation.en: So I thought, "If I don't take the blame, she's never gonna get her kids back."
translation.ko: 제가 뒤집어쓰지 않으면 누나가 애들을 못 볼 것 같았죠 "경찰 취조 영상"

translation.en: [Brittany] The next morning, I woke up. My heart sank.
I told Mom, "I have to go turn myself in."
[detective] What you originally told us, that your brother shot him.
[Brittany] Yes.
[detective] Now you're saying it was actually you that actually shot him.
[Brittany cries] I shoulda told the truth from the beginning.
[Ramona] She never should have been took to jail. None of that is fair.
translation.ko: 절대 감옥에 가선 안 됐어요 전부 억울한 일이니까요

translation.en: I taught her to fight, fight back with everything you've got, and she did.
translation.ko: 무슨 수를 쓰든 싸워 살아남으라고 제가 가르친 대로 했을 뿐이거든요

translation.en: And I'm proud of her for it.
Ooh, they're all pretty. Swirl 'em up.
[girl laughs] Look at that big one.
[Brittany cries] Like, I went everywhere, and nobody will give me a job right now.
translation.ko: 온갖 곳을 다녀봤는데 아무도 절 고용하지 않아요

translation.en: And the only thing that ke… that makes me happy
is spending time with my kids.
And I can't even do that, for real?
You want to?
I want to be able to do what I'm able to do with my neighbor's kids.
translation.ko: 이웃집 아이들과 놀듯이 우리 아이들과도 놀고 싶어요

translation.en: Oh, that's funny! Look at that.
[Brittany] I can't do this with my own babies.
[girl] Bubbles!
"Further grounds will be set forth
in more detail at the time of the hearings…"
Stand Your Ground, when I first heard of it, I thought,
translation.ko: 처음 스탠드 유어 그라운드법을 알게 되었을 때는

translation.en: "That fits her situation perfectly."
She was arrested for self-defense.
I studied it. I went online. I got a law book.
translation.ko: "자기방어를 위한 물리력 행사를 정당한 것으로 본다" 저도 공부했어요, 인터넷으로도 조사하고 법률책도 샀죠

translation.en: I thought, "Yes, this is her law that's gonna get her out of this."
translation.ko: 이 법이면 우리 애를 구제할 수 있을 거라 생각했어요

translation.en: [Brittany] Wow.
-That's good news. -[Chris] Is that your cup?
Yep.
And we'll have the Stand Your Ground,
and then we're gonna ask for those charges to be dismissed.
She had every right. She was in her own home.
translation.ko: 애한텐 그럴 권리가 있었어요 자기 집에 있었다고요

translation.en: This is classic Stand Your Ground.
I think Brittany's story is very credible, and we had the law on our side.
translation.ko: 브리트니 증언의 신뢰도도 높고 법도 우리 편이라 믿었어요

translation.en: She's not engaged in an unlawful activity. She's not the initial aggressor.
translation.ko: "론 스미스 변호사" 불법 행위에도 연루되지 않았고 먼저 공격하지도 않았죠

translation.en: She's basically at the house. The brother is being choked out by Todd.
translation.ko: 자기 집에 있었으며 남동생이 토드에게 목 졸리고 있었잖아요

translation.en: Choke hold is deadly force.
translation.ko: 팔로 목을 졸랐다간 죽을 수도 있어요

translation.en: She was justified in that.
translation.ko: "브리트니 스미스의 경찰 취조 기록" 정당한 행위였죠

translation.en: I think we had a strong Stand Your Ground case.
translation.ko: 스탠드 유어 그라운드법으로 이길 가능성이 높다고 봤어요

translation.en: The DA got with Todd's family,
and they wanted me to take a 25-year plea deal.
I told 'em I'm not pleading out to anything. No.
translation.ko: 전 절대 그렇게 못 한다고 했죠

translation.en: Because I'm innocent, and I will go to jail an innocent woman
translation.ko: 전 무죄거든요 하지도 않은 일을 인정하느니

translation.en: before I'll plea out to anything that I did not do.
[Ron] Brittany's perspective was, "I'm not gonna plead guilty."
translation.ko: 브리트니는 절대로 유죄 협상을 안 한다고 했죠

translation.en: "We're taking the Stand Your Ground hearing."
[woman] I… I enjoy working with Ron Smith as a private investigator.
translation.ko: 론 스미스 아래에서 보람차게 사설탐정 일을 하고 있어요

translation.en: And I'm former law enforcement. I got out of law enforcement several years ago
translation.ko: 전엔 경찰이었어요 몇 년 전에 경찰 일을 그만뒀죠

translation.en: because I thought that there was a need also for cases on the defense side.
translation.ko: 변호하는 입장에서도 도움이 필요하단 생각이 들어서요 "돈 헨드릭스 사설탐정"

translation.en: There's people that live in low-income areas.
They don't have an investigator for their side,
translation.ko: 그분들은 자기를 위해 일해줄 탐정이 없어서

translation.en: so that's where that need is filled.
Typically in the South in your Stand Your Ground,
translation.ko: 스탠드 유어 그라운드법이 미국 남부에서 적용될 때는

translation.en: it's a man standin' up and protecting their life, liberty, property,
translation.ko: 대개 남자가 목숨, 자유 혹은 재산을 지키려던 경우예요 "보안관서: 12월 총격 사망 사건 집주인 불기소"

translation.en: all of this that we've always heard.
Men get praised for that.
translation.ko: "플로렌스 살인 피고인 스탠드 유어 그라운드법으로 무죄" 남자들은 오히려 칭찬을 들어요

translation.en: Where, if a woman does that or a minority,
translation.ko: 그런데 여자나 소수 민족은 비슷한 상황에서

translation.en: it's viewed a lot different.
I think, in the South, a lot of times people don't believe that
there's a problem with sexual abuse and domestic violence.
Why is it okay for a woman to sustain injuries
translation.ko: 왜 여자들은 당연히 고통받고 계속 견뎌야 하나요?

translation.en: and continue to endure that before something's done?
I'm for the underdog.
You know, I think I've always been for the underdog.
[Ramona] We actually got a date for the Stand Your Ground hearing.
translation.ko: 스탠드 유어 그라운드 심리 날짜가 잡혔어요

translation.en: It's, uh, January 14th, 2020.
And we're excited.
Praying, praying that this will be over. This nightmare will be over.
translation.ko: 이 악몽이 어서 끝나기를 기도하고 있어요

translation.en: I'm hoping that this goes through
because it shouldn't just be a law for men.
Period.
[Ashley] When Brittany testified, you coulda heard a pin drop in that room.
translation.ko: 브리트니가 증언할 땐 다들 쥐 죽은 듯 조용했어요

translation.en: It was just silent.
[Ron] "Now, Brittany." "Yes, sir."
"Todd had come over initially with permission?"
"Yes, sir."
"When he was attacking you in your house, did he still have permission to be there?"
translation.ko: '토드가 집에서 공격했을 때도 머물러도 좋다고 한 상태였나요?'

translation.en: "No, sir."
"When attacking your brother, did he have permission?"
translation.ko: '남동생을 공격할 땐 머물러도 좋다고 한 상황인가요?'

translation.en: "No, sir."
"Were you afraid he would hurt you?"
"He did hurt me."
The sexual assault nurse examiner
testified to 33 injuries on Brittany.
translation.ko: 브리트니 몸에서 나온 상처 33개에 대해 증언했어요

translation.en: And the nurse's testimony was very compelling.
"There were two abrasions on the left side of the chin,
and they were consistent with a bite mark."
"There were wounds to the chest, to the breasts, legs, arms, feet."
And then, "She had a contusion that was consistent with a handprint."
And then, "She had contusions to the back of the neck."
"I would say my findings were consistent with a strangulation."
translation.ko: '검진 결과는 목 졸렸을 때의 상처와 일치합니다'

translation.en: [Ramona] I mean, just cried like a baby.
Because that was my baby girl on that paper.
[Ashley] The nurse also testified that she could not say with certainty
that Brittany had been sexually assaulted.
But the nurse was clear about that,
that it's not unusual in sexual assault cases
that you can't say with any certainty, you know, that someone was raped.
translation.ko: 강간인지 확신할 수 없는 경우가 흔하다고요

translation.en: [Ron] Her story is corroborated by her injuries.
[Brittany over phone] I don't know what to do. I, like…
-I've been choked almost dead, like… -[operator] Yes.
[Brittany] …raped almost in my bed twice.
[operator] So, he did rape you?
[Brittany] No, he did not rape me. He was trying to.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 안 했어요 강간하려고 하긴 했지만요

translation.en: In the 911 call, Brittany said that she had not been raped.
translation.ko: 911 신고 전화에서 브리트니는 강간당하지 않았다고 했어요

translation.en: Prosecutor Jason Pierce asked Brittany,
"Why would you lie about not being raped?"
Brittany, "I don't know."
Brittany's lawyers brought in information that Brittany had been diagnosed with PTSD
and that something like, you know, saying in the moment,
"No, I wasn't raped," wouldn't be out of the question
for somebody who had been traumatized.
Do you want to just spill your guts to… to a stranger
and tell 'em, "Okay, yeah, I just got sexually assaulted and raped."
A lot of rape victims don't disclose immediately.
translation.ko: 곧장 강간 사실을 밝히는 피해자는 많지 않아요

translation.en: It might be years.
[Ashley] Prosecutor Jason Pierce says, "It seems like you have selective memory."
translation.ko: 제이슨 피어스 검사는 이렇게 말했어요 '기억을 선택적으로 하시나 보군요'

translation.en: I mean, obviously, the… the whole point of… of the prosecution was to cast doubt right on her story.
translation.ko: 검사 측에서는 브리트니 증언의 진실성을 깎아내려야 했으니까요

translation.en: She was obviously being asked about some really difficult things,
translation.ko: 답하기 매우 어려운 질문을 많이 받고 있었는데

translation.en: but I would say she was really measured.
The prosecutor asked Brittany,
"You hadn't seen him with a weapon of any sort that evening?"
translation.ko: '그날 밤 토드가 무기를 들고 있는 걸 봤나요?'

translation.en: Brittany answers, "His hands."
Mr. Pierce says, "Okay. And that would be--"
Brittany cuts in and says, "And his penis."
"And his mouth."
"I saw several weapons."
[Ron] Todd Smith had very high levels of methamphetamine in his system.
translation.ko: 토드 스미스의 혈액에서 메스암페타민이 다량 검출됐어요

translation.en: Extremely high.
The toxicologist testifies that 200 would be, like, a common amount
translation.ko: 약물 검사 전문가 증언에 따르면 보통 메스암페타민에 취해

translation.en: that you would see in a DUI case where someone is on meth.
[Ron] If you see a video,
translation.ko: "메스암페타민 수치 밀리리터당 840나노그램" 이런 영상도 있어요 경찰이 한 남자를 체포하려는데

translation.en: and there's somebody trying to be restrained by the police,
translation.ko: 이런 영상도 있어요 경찰이 한 남자를 체포하려는데

translation.en: and there's five officers tasing him and hitting him with their clubs,
translation.ko: 경관 다섯 명이 붙어서 전기 충격기와 경봉을 써도

translation.en: and the guy keeps fighting like Superman,
she said that is similar
translation.ko: 혈중 메스암페타민 농도가 그 정도로 높으면

translation.en: to what that level of meth in your system would produce.
translation.ko: 혈중 메스암페타민 농도가 그 정도로 높으면 그렇게 날뛸 수 있다더군요

translation.en: I asked him, "What's that make you feel like?" He said, "Superman."
translation.ko: 어떤 기분이냐고 물었더니 슈퍼맨이 된 것 같다더군요

translation.en: Me and Todd, we were real close. He's like a brother to me.
translation.ko: 저랑 토드는 많이 친했어요 친형제나 다름없었죠

translation.en: I remember having our four-wheelers and motorcycles up the mountain.
translation.ko: 사륜구동차와 오토바이를 타고 함께 산을 오르곤 했어요

translation.en: There's a little creek there.
We'd always get us a drink of water there out of the spring.
translation.ko: 거기서 솟는 샘에서 목을 축이고는 했어요

translation.en: If you really didn't know Todd, weren't around him every day,
translation.ko: 토드를 잘 알고 또 늘 함께하지 않으면

translation.en: you wouldn't understand him.
Todd was a totally different person if it hadn't been for drugs.
translation.ko: 마약을 안 했더라면 전혀 다른 사람이 됐을 텐데요

translation.en: [Ashley] This is, like, a criminal history printout for Todd Smith.
There are definitely dozens of arrests here.
Some of these are domestic violence charges.
There's another assault.
-[tense music intensifies] -Aggravated assault.
[Brittany] Todd's ex-wife knows what I went through.
translation.ko: 토드의 전 부인은 제가 무슨 일을 겪었는지 알아요

translation.en: She's lucky to be alive, and she's a very brave soul.
[woman] I was held captive numerous times by Todd and beaten over the years.
translation.ko: 토드에게 여러 차례 감금됐고 오랫동안 폭행을 당했어요 "토드 스미스의 전 부인 팟캐스트 인터뷰"

translation.en: The last story I had that reminded me so much of Brittany was
translation.ko: 마지막으로 겪은 일을 생각하면 브리트니가 참 많이 떠올라요

translation.en: I was duct-taped and tied to a chair.
I had been held captive by him for days. Beaten, raped, sodomized.
translation.ko: 며칠이나 갇혀 폭행과 강간 항문 강간을 당했어요

translation.en: Everything Brittany had went through and… and more.
translation.ko: 브리트니가 당한 일을 포함해 그 이상을 당했죠

translation.en: [Ashley] During the Stand Your Ground hearing,
like, repeatedly brought up by her prosecutor, Jason Pierce,
translation.ko: 제이슨 피어스 검사가 계속 이런 의문을 제기했죠

translation.en: was the question of, "Is Brittany credible?"
The night that the assault happened,
Brittany initially just reached out to her mom.
She didn't call the police.
Todd said, "If you call the police, I will kill you."
translation.ko: 토드가 경찰을 부르면 저를 죽인다고 했어요

translation.en: But I had to get some help somehow.
So I said, "Let's go smoke a cigarette."
I knew I didn't have cigarettes.
I knew I was gonna have to call somebody 'cause I didn't have a car at the time.
[Ramona] That night, when she called me, he had it on speakerphone.
translation.ko: "딸 오늘 오전 12시 49분" 그날 밤 저에게 전화했을 때 토드가 스피커폰으로 해놨대요

translation.en: He could hear what she was sayin'.
'Cause he didn't want her lettin' anybody know what had happened.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있었는지 남에게 말 못 하게 막으려던 거죠

translation.en: [Ashley] Also, Paige Painter testified about being at work,
translation.ko: 게다가 페이지 페인터는 직장에서 일하던 그 날 밤

translation.en: uh, the night that Brittany came into the store
and told her that she had been assaulted.
[Paige] Brittany said, "Give me a piece of paper and a pen."
And she started writing down names and phone numbers.
She said, "If something happens to me, Todd Smith did it."
translation.ko: "토드 스미스 테네시주 재스퍼 그로버힐" 자기가 잘못되면 토드 스미스 짓이라면서요

translation.en: And, uh, she said, "Call… call my mom and tell her to come get me."
translation.ko: 또 자기 엄마에게 연락해서 데리러 오라고 전해 달랬어요

translation.en: [Ashley] "Can you explain that, please?"
"Somehow, you believed your mother would be in a better position
to handle violent, angry Todd than a police officer?"
[Brittany] I really wanted my mom.
Because, in Jackson County, I feel like the police are always on the man's side,
translation.ko: 게다가 잭슨 카운티 경찰들은 늘 남자 편을 들거든요

translation.en: but, um, I know that my mother would have got him out of that house.
translation.ko: 하지만 엄마라면 토드를 내쫓아 줄 줄 알았죠

translation.en: [woman] I've seen police officers show up in Jackson County
to a domestic violence call and tell people,
translation.ko: 가정 폭력 현장에 출동해서 이런 말을 해요

translation.en: "Look, both of y'all are gonna go to jail."
"It's not gonna be one of y'all. Both of you are gonna go."
translation.ko: "케일라 피어슨 브리트니의 이웃" '둘 중 하나가 아니라 둘 다 감옥행이라고요'

translation.en: Instead of actually trying to figure out what happened.
[Paige] Around here, usually, women get the short end of the stick.
My mom, her and her ex-husband fought constantly,
like, beating each other up.
And my mom would… she would go to jail every single time.
So I am not shocked at all that Brittany wanted me to call her mom.
translation.ko: 브리트니가 엄마에게 연락한 것도 제겐 놀라운 일이 아니에요

translation.en: [woman] During the trial, there was a lot of women
translation.ko: "강간 피해자가 구금당했다 브리트니에게 정의를" 재판 기간에 브리트니를 위해 시위한 여성분이 참 많아요

translation.en: that were marching for Brittany.
translation.ko: 재판 기간에 브리트니를 위해 시위한 여성분이 참 많아요 "스스로를 지켰단 이유로 감옥행은 부당하다"

translation.en: And there was a lot of stories that were told that day.
translation.ko: 그날 참 많은 사연을 들을 수 있었죠 "샌드라 굿맨 피해자 대변인"

translation.en: Women are coming out and talking more about what has happened to them
translation.ko: 여성들이 무슨 일이 있었는지 솔직하게 터놓고 말하며

translation.en: and how the justice system has failed them as well.
translation.ko: 법체계가 정의 구현에 어떻게 실패했는지도 전했죠

translation.en: But, you know, they're willing to stand up and fight now.
translation.ko: 하지만 이제는 다들 일어나 싸울 생각인 거예요

translation.en: They're… they're ready to see a change.
[Brittany] There's been so many women reach out to me and share their stories.
translation.ko: "나도 강간 생존자야 대단한 분이라고 생각해" 참 많은 여성이 자기 사연과 함께 저에게 연락을 해주셨어요

translation.en: People that are minorities, different races, different sexualities, religions.
translation.ko: 소수 민족, 다른 인종 다른 성 정체성, 다른 종교인까지

translation.en: Everybody reaching out to me, telling me that they've been abused,
and they've went to the police, but the police wouldn't make an arrest.
translation.ko: "전 가정 폭력의 생존자예요" 자기들도 신고했지만 경찰이 체포하지 않았대요 "이래서 나서지 못하는 겁니다"

translation.en: And some of them are women in jail for fighting back.
translation.ko: 감옥에서 싸우고 계시는 여성분들도 계셨어요 "저도 강간 피해자예요 지지 말고 힘내요!"

translation.en: A lot were from Alabama,
translation.ko: 앨라배마 분들도 많았고요 "여자도 자기방어할 권리가 있어야 한다"

translation.en: and they've been from North Carolina, from New York, New Mexico,
translation.ko: "여자도 자기방어할 권리가 있어야 한다" 노스캐롤라이나 뉴욕, 뉴멕시코까지 "저도 당했어요 정의가 구현되기 바라요"

translation.en: from just everywhere.
The Stand Your Ground law is for white men only, from what I've seen.
translation.ko: 제 눈에 스탠드 유어 그라운드법은 백인 남성만을 위한 법이에요

translation.en: It's not for minorities. It's not for women. It's for white men.
translation.ko: "폭행범을 막은 죄로 구속된 뉴욕 여성, 선처 호소" 소수 민족이나 여성이 아니라 백인 남성을 위한 법이죠

translation.en: And I don't think that's fair.
translation.ko: "인종에 따른 이중 잣대 논란" 불공평한 일이죠

translation.en: They've lit a fire in me.
We're just little nobodies over here. That's the way we're viewed.
translation.ko: 저희는 아무 의미도 없는 존재예요 그렇게밖에 안 보이는 거죠

translation.en: But when you get a ton of little nobodies together…
translation.ko: 그렇지만 아무 의미 없는 존재라도 수백, 수천이 모인다면…

translation.en: especially pissed-off women,
they become somebody big.
We are somebody.
We have a voice. We're fixing to use it.
translation.ko: 우리도 목소리가 있어요 그 목소리를 낼 겁니다

translation.en: [Brittany] I want to get my children back.
I want them to know that Mommy's not a murderer,
translation.ko: 엄마가 살인자가 아니란 걸 알려주고 싶어요

translation.en: that Mommy defended herself, and that you should always defend yourself.
translation.ko: 엄마는 스스로를 지켰을 뿐이고 사람은 누구나 그래야 한다고요

translation.en: I pray. I pray that everything goes okay.
It will.
It will.
[Ashley] A few weeks after the Stand Your Ground hearing,
translation.ko: 스탠드 유어 그라운드 심리 몇 주 후에

translation.en: Judge Holt issued a 19-page order denying Stand Your Ground immunity.
translation.ko: 홀트 판사가 19쪽짜리 명령문으로 스탠드 유어 그라운드 면책을 기각했어요

translation.en: And essentially, the judge wrote that Brittany had not proven
that she was legally justified in pulling the trigger.
Did Todd attack Brittany Smith?
Well, it… it seems pretty clear that he did.
The judge probably believed the attack happened.
translation.ko: 판사도 공격은 실제로 있었다고 믿었을 거예요

translation.en: Of course, that's not when Brittany Smith shot Todd.
translation.ko: 물론 브리트니가 토드를 쏜 건 그때가 아니에요

translation.en: Was she justified in believing
that Todd was going to kill or going to seriously injure her brother?
translation.ko: 동생에게 중상을 입힐 거라고 믿은 게 정당하냐는 문제죠

translation.en: That's the issue, and I think the judge thought
translation.ko: 그게 문제인데 판사는 우리 명령 신청을 기각하면서

translation.en: it was an important factor when she denied our motion.
translation.ko: 그게 문제인데 판사는 우리 명령 신청을 기각하면서 그 점을 중요하게 본 것 같아요

translation.en: [Ashley] "Upon consideration of all the evidence,
translation.ko: "피고인은 토드에게서 도망칠 기회가 많았다" '모든 증거를 검토한 결과'

translation.en: the court finds that the defendant has given inconsistent accounts
translation.ko: '토드의 사망 사건과 관련해 피고인이 앞뒤가 맞지 않는 말을'

translation.en: of the events surrounding Todd's death."
For example, Brittany's initial lie
translation.ko: 예를 들어 브리트니가 처음에 거짓말을 했죠

translation.en: that her brother had been the one who pulled the trigger
did kind of come back to haunt her.
In the eyes of the judge, it did harm, like, her credibility.
translation.ko: 판사가 보기엔 브리트니의 증언 신뢰도가 떨어질 수밖에요

translation.en: And so I think it was pretty clear that the judge did not believe her testimony.
translation.ko: 판사가 브리트니의 증언을 믿지 않은 것으로 보여요

translation.en: [Brittany whispers] It's gonna be okay. Okay?
It's gonna be okay.
[Ashley] Most of the reaction that I recall getting from readers
translation.ko: 제 기억에 독자 대부분의 반응은 이랬어요

translation.en: was just, like, "I still think she's innocent."
They didn't care what the judge said.
translation.ko: 다들 판사 말에는 신경 안 쓰더라고요

translation.en: I hate that Todd had to get shot and killed over it,
translation.ko: 토드가 총을 맞아 죽은 건 정말로 안타깝지만

translation.en: but I really do believe she was defending herself.
translation.ko: 그 여자분은 스스로를 방어한 거라고 믿어요

translation.en: Probably feels funny for me saying that, 'cause I'm Todd's cousin, but…
translation.ko: 이상하게 들릴지도 모르겠네요 전 토드의 사촌이니까요

translation.en: I don't want to see her go to prison. I really don't.
translation.ko: 그렇지만 그분이 감옥에 가는 건 원치 않아요

translation.en: You say it's okay for women to defend themselves,
but when they do, be ready for what society has for you.
translation.ko: 실제로 그런 일이 벌어지면 사회의 반응은 냉담합니다

translation.en: It's not the law per se that needs to change.
translation.ko: 법 자체가 바뀌어야 하는 게 아니라

translation.en: It's our perceptions of how we think women should fit into the mold.
translation.ko: 우리가 여성에게 강요하는 머릿속 틀이 문제예요

translation.en: And for them to use aggression
even against an attacker of rape or anything like that,
translation.ko: 벗어나기 위해서라도 폭력을 써선 안 된다는 게

translation.en: it's the way we perceive that.
And when you've got cases that are involving minorities, women,
let's look at why people are not given the same consideration.
translation.ko: 왜 이 사람들은 같은 처우를 받지 못하는지 봐야 해요

translation.en: That's a society problem. That's a stereotype problem.
My attorneys showed me the last offer, and I was just like, "What would you do?"
translation.ko: 변호인단이 마지막 제안을 하길래 당신이라면 어쩌겠냐고 물었더니

translation.en: They said, "I would take it."
"Because you're not gonna get away with no time."
Well, I know that I did it for my kids.
They'll feel better knowing that it's over with.
translation.ko: 다 끝난 걸 알면 아이들도 안도할 테니까요

translation.en: You know? Like, I made a good decision.
My mom's okay. My brother's… Everybody's okay.
And my kids are okay.
I'll be okay. I'm just…
Mentally, I'm trying to just stay sane back here.
translation.ko: 여기서 제정신을 유지하려고 어떻게든 노력 중이에요

translation.en: She said that she felt, like, essentially backed into a corner
because, if she went to trial, the judge who would sentence her
if she was convicted is the judge who had written a 19-page order
translation.ko: 자기 증언 신뢰성을 의심해 19쪽짜리 명령문을 쓴

translation.en: questioning her credibility.
And so, the way she described it to me
was that she took kind of the lesser of… of the evils and… and took the… the plea deal.
translation.ko: 차악을 선택해서 유죄 협상을 한 거라고요

translation.en: She would get credit for time that she had already served in jail,
translation.ko: "치른 형량, 333일" 재판을 기다리며 감옥에서 보낸 시간은

translation.en: awaiting her trial.
So it was a six-month sentence, essentially, for murder.
translation.ko: 따라서 살인죄에 6개월 형이 나온 거나 마찬가지죠

translation.en: And then the next 18 months, she would be on house arrest.
Do you risk it all?
Do you play Russian roulette
with people that you don't even know to decide your fate?
translation.ko: 모르는 사람들에게 내 인생의 운명을 맡기겠어요?

translation.en: So I understand why she took a plea agreement.
translation.ko: 무슨 맘으로 유죄 협상을 했는지 저는 이해해요

translation.en: I don't know. I mean, I can't fault her for that.
translation.ko: 모르겠네요 어쨌든 브리트니 탓은 못 하죠

translation.en: It's just disheartening.
It'll always be on her record that she has a felony conviction for murder.
translation.ko: 살인죄로 중죄를 선고받았단 게 전과로 평생 남을 겁니다

translation.en: And that'll… that'll always follow her.
[Brittany] It makes no sense to me that the plea deals that were offered to me
translation.ko: 도대체 이해가 안 가요 저에게 주어진 유죄 협상이

translation.en: were six months for murder and, uh, a lot more time for manslaughter.
I do not understand how a murder charge
translation.ko: 왜 살인죄가 고살죄보다 형량이 적은지 이해가 안 가요

translation.en: is less than… than a manslaughter. It doesn't make sense to me.
translation.ko: 왜 살인죄가 고살죄보다 형량이 적은지 이해가 안 가요 말이 안 되잖아요

translation.en: They were… The court system here wanted me to take that murder charge
translation.ko: 법원은 제가 살인죄를 인정하기를 원한 거예요

translation.en: just to say that I took that charge.
I was so dead set on saying, "I'm not pleading guilty to that murder charge."
translation.ko: 절대로 살인죄는 인정 못 한다고 얼마나 단단히 맘을 먹었었는데요

translation.en: [sobs] And I feel like I let a lot of people down.
translation.ko: 많은 사람에게 실망을 안겨준 것 같아 속상해요

translation.en: [sobs] And I did let myself down too,
but it's something that I fought with every day. [sniffs]
[Ramona] Hi, baby.
What are you doing?
-[Brittany] You're so pretty. -No, I'm not.
How are you doing in there?
[Brittany] It was fun on Halloween.
We dressed up, and, um… Hold on.
-Well, Lynn. -[Lynn] What?
[Brittany] Lynn was a black-eyed pea.
She colored her eye black… [laughs] …and put a "P" on her shirt.
Lauren was a "cereal" killer.
She had a cereal bag… [laughs] …around her neck, and it said "killer" on the inside of it.
translation.ko: 목에 시리얼 봉지를 두르고 안에 '킬러'라고 써놨지

translation.en: I was the Statue of Liberty.
[sighs] To be stuck in jail and away from your kids on Halloween…
translation.ko: 아이들과 떨어져 감옥에서 핼러윈을 보낸 것치고는

translation.en: It was… it was the best Halloween I could've had in here.
translation.ko: 이보다 즐겁게 보낼 순 없었을 것 같아

translation.en: I'm gonna have to go get me a, um… a DUI or something or a public intoxication
translation.ko: 엄마가 음주 운전이나 공공장소 주취죄로라도 걸려야

translation.en: just so I can see you and give you a hug.
[Ramona] Your time's up, baby.
Ten seconds.
-[Brittany] I love you. -I love you.
[Brittany] All right.
[Ramona] The Christmas lights make me sad.
You see everybody else. They're running around here,
translation.ko: 남들을 보면요 다들 크리스마스에 아이에게 뭘 사 줄지 이야기하는데

translation.en: talking about what they're gonna buy their kids for Christmas,
translation.ko: 다들 크리스마스에 아이에게 뭘 사 줄지 이야기하는데

translation.en: and I'm gonna be worried about,
"Is she gonna even get a dinner for Christmas or Thanksgiving?"
translation.ko: 애가 저녁이라도 제대로 먹을지 걱정하고 있네요

translation.en: Brittany didn't deserve what she got.
She's been raped and beaten by him and almost killed.
translation.ko: 그놈에게 강간과 폭행을 당하고 거의 죽을 뻔했다고요

translation.en: And now, she's been raped and beaten by the system.
translation.ko: 이제는 법체계에 강간과 폭행을 당하고 있네요

translation.en: [Ashley] If you think that Todd was a victim,
do you consider what Brittany got justice?
translation.ko: 브리트니가 유죄 판결 받은 게 정의 실현이라고 보세요?

translation.en: And if you don't think Todd was, and you think she was the victim,
translation.ko: 토드가 피해자가 아니라 브리트니가 피해자라고 해도

translation.en: then I can't imagine you think that she got justice either.
It's like, no matter whose side you were on,
I don't know that you really will find justice in this story.
translation.ko: 이 사건에서는 정의가 실현됐다고 보기 어려워요
